system.biography:
TitleFFF 106-1 Khuzdul MF
Birthday11 Kelen 619
AppearanceAge 100, height 4’9”, massive frame, weight 145 lb, average appearance, fair complexion, red hair, green eyes.
Medical/PsycheNone
Size4
ArmorFine quality heavy cloth tunic and leggings, shortsleeved quilt gambeson, Khuzan mail byrnie, leather belt and shoes, dagger, Khuzan short sword and hammer-axe. Add quilt cowl, Khuzan plate helm and steel round shield if he has time to prepare.
Other EquipmentBelt pouch, tinder box, elaborately decorated pipe and pouch of pipeweed, mule (named Stubborn), campaigning gear.
Valuables360d in silver, 2 gold coins (320d each), large gold earrings, silver belt buckle.
Notes

Biography

Eitri Terrika is the third son of one of Azadmere’s greatest metalsmiths. Although quite skilled, Eitri did not rise to the level of a master smith and his father endlessly denigrated his work. One day, in a fit of anger at the constant belittling, Eitri punched his father in the face, knocking him unconscious. For the crime of assaulting his father, Eitri was exiled and doomed to walk among the humans for the rest of his life.

Disgusted with his family, Eitri has sworn never again to work as a smith. In addition to his smithing abilities, Eitri was a skilled warrior and decided to become a mercenary instead. Using his own funds, he purchased a very fine mail byrnie, three-quarter helm, and steel shield from Clan Klarazhal, as well as a hammer-axe and short sword from Clan Mazrabul. Suitably equipped, he headed out into the wider world. In combat, he prefers the hammeraxe and shield, with the short sword as his backup weapon.

Eitri has been wandering among the humans for 46 years now. He specializes in attacks on gargun, the traditional foe of the Khuzdul. Eitri’s skill at ferreting o the entrances to gargun colonies guarantees him steady employment. Due to his skill with the axe, especially axe versus sword, Eitri is also in demand as an instructor, both by those wishing to fight with an axe and those wishing to learn how to counter one. A lifetime of combat against humans has taught him how to compensate for his stature and shorter reach. Anyone who underestimates his strength, speed, and stamina are in for a rude awakening.

Adventure Hooks

Reinforcements. The PCs are heading into battle and need some extra combat power. Eitri has just completed a contract and is available. He comes with a list of references as long as your leg.

Khuzdul Expert. The PCs have come across something Khuzan (tunnels, armour, weapons, etc.) and need some advice. Eitri is known in the community as the local dwarf expert.

Implacable Enemy. The PCs get into a conflict with an NPC. Eitri is one of his retainers. After the PCs are victorious, the Khuzdul takes their victory as a personal offence and proceeds to hunt them down.

Last Request. Eitri is one of the PCs allies. He is horribly wounded in combat. His last request is for the PCs to take him home to Azadmere so he can die among his own people. When they arrive at Zerhun, they are permitted to enter the kingdom.

Credits

This character is taken from “Friends, Foes, and Followers, Vol. 1” on Lythia.com (https://www.lythia.com/game_aides/friends-foes-followers-volume-1/), by Kerry Mould, with illustrations by Richard Luscheck and Juha Makkonen, and is “fanon”, a derivative work of copyrighted material by Columbia Games Inc. and N. Robin Crossby.
